profile_data.summary:
I am Rahul Kumar, and I have a deep passion for Computer Vision, Machine Learning, and Robotics. I am currently pursuing a Master's degree in Robotics at Northeastern University, where I have developed a solid foundation in advanced robotics, computer vision, and machine learning techniques. My professional experience at Tesla and Maruti Suzuki has provided me with valuable opportunities to apply computer vision and machine learning, including deep learning, as well as CAD modeling, to optimize automation processes and improve efficiency in real-world applications. 

I am driven by the potential of AI to revolutionize our future from autonomous vehicles to smart factories and advancements in healthcare. I am committed to using my expertise to innovate and tackle complex challenges in robotics and AI, with the goal of contributing to a smarter, more efficient, and better world.
profile_data.headline: MS in Robotics @Northeastern University||Research Assistant @NEU - ICET Lab||Ex-Tesla,Maruti Suzuki||Robotics||Computer Vision||Machine Learning||AI

experience.description:
▪  Developed Winding-Constrained Motion Planning for Tethered Robot using Hybrid A*. (Refer to Publication section)
▪ Engineered algorithm for NASA-sponsored ExoPlanetary Rover motion planning, specializing in anchor prediction with obstacles for tether-constrained motion; implemented algorithm with Python.
▪ Derived and implemented static stability analysis of rover given anchor position and rover configuration.
▪ Incorporated non-Markovian nature of chain-terrain interaction in ABIT* motion planning algorithm in python for Multi-Robot motion for Planetary Exploration such as Mars.
experience.title: Research Assistant

experience.description:
▪ Developed deep learning based object detection method for assembly station using YOLOv8 and PyTorch, reducing rejection by 10%.
▪ Prepared annotated dataset for efficient model training and optimized data pipelines for faster model deployment.
▪ Programmed and fine-tuned the Gantry system using Python for precise adhesive dispensing, achieving an efficiency improvement of 12% and reducing material waste by 20%.
▪ Designed and developed a Vacuum-Actuated robotic system for PCB handling with SolidWorks, incorporating OpenCV in C++ for orientation detection; improved lifting accuracy, leading to a 15% increase in production speed.
▪ Employing SolidWorks, developed fully automated Press and HIPOT testing station, equipped with multiple sensors to ensure robust performance.
▪ Conducted simulations of robots' movements using Roboguide software to ensure optimal clearances, contributing to the seamless integration of automation processes.
experience.title: Robotics/Automation Engineering Intern

experience.description:
▪  Led $10M automation of production plant with end-to-end machine learning implementation, utilizing various AWS such as Kinesis for real-time data ingestion, Redshift for managing large datasets, Glue for distributed data processing & ETL, and SageMaker for model training and deployment to optimize IoT data pipelines.
▪  Built and deployed real-time anomaly detection model using LSTM Autoencoders, machine learning algorithm, on sensor data, facilitating predictive maintenance, reducing downtime by 10%, and optimizing system performance.
▪  Deployed highly-scalable ML models, including Vision Transformers (ViT) on EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service) using CI/CD pipelines, leveraging GitHub Actions to verify, build & publish container images to ECR (Elastic Container Registry), improving model performance on large datasets.
▪  Developed and deployed machine learning models, including Random Forest and Boosting algorithms, using Scikit-learn and Python on edge devices for real-time defect detection, enhancing quality control by reducing latency.
▪  Enhanced manufacturing processes by integrating ML algorithms with IoT frameworks, creating analytics platforms that improved machine performance and reduced defects by 8%, increasing output by 10%.
experience.title: Machine Learning Engineer

experience.description:
▪ Implemented deep learning based YOLOv5 CNN model for object recognition and pose estimation, integrated with inverse kinematics algorithm and ROS to enable a robot arm to accurately pick and place bolts in an assembly line.
▪ Developed U-Net Neural Network model for image segmentation to accurately detect cracks in components from endoscope camera images, enhancing inspection accuracy.
▪ Engineered an image processing system using OpenCV and C++ to scan QR codes and identify marks on parts for process control, ensuring accurate tracking and automation in the production line.
▪ Built scalable data preprocessing pipelines using Python, Pandas, and PySpark, enabling efficient feature extraction and large-scale model training deployments.
▪ Optimized production capacity by automating and robotizing existing process; lowered overheads by 4%.
▪ Reduced project budget by $200,000 through in-house designing of machine fixtures employing Solidworks.
▪ Programmed CNC and Coordinate Measuring Machine (CMM) operations to optimize product quality and efficiency, incorporating automated feedback loops to refine machining processes continuously.
▪ Awarded for outstanding contributions to manufacturing safety, enhancing robotic assembly operations with automated safety solutions and sensor-based safety systems.
▪ Developed and refined manufacturing processes for high-precision engine components, leveraging automated systems and robotics for product testing and validation, achieving exemplary process capability indices.
experience.title: Robotics and Computer Vision Engineer

experience.companyName: UDAAN (Robotics and Aerodynamics) Club, NIT Rourkela
experience.description:
As President of the Robotics and Aerodynamics club at my university, I played a key role in managing the club's operations and leading the development of several projects.

My responsibilities included:
▪ Overseeing the management and administration of the club, ensuring smooth coordination of all activities.
▪ Planning and organizing events, projects, and initiatives to engage club members and showcase our work
▪ Mentoring and guiding fellow club members, helping them develop their technical skills and project management capabilities
▪ Generating innovative ideas in the fields of aerodynamics, robotics, and UAV (Unmanned Aerial Vehicle) design
▪ Testing and validating our conceptual models through rigorous experimentation and analysis
▪ Securing funding from the university and external sponsors to support the club's activities and project development

Through this experience, I honed my leadership, problem-solving, and communication skills. I learned to be a mentor and guide to my colleagues, while also benefiting from their knowledge and insights. The hands-on project work allowed me to apply classroom learnings to real-world engineering challenges, further developing my technical expertise.
experience.title: President

publications.name: Stability of Tethered Ground Robots on Extreme Terrains
publications.description: In the absence of a tether attachment mechanism that can provide infinitely large tension to the tethered robots moving on extreme planetary terrains, there is a limit on how much tension can be realistically generated or supported by the tether. In this paper, we consider a team of two robots tethered together moving on extreme terrains. The traction on the wheels of the robot and the friction between the tether and the tether attachment surfaces/objects (e.g., rocks) is the only way to support the tether tension. Given a path for the robots to navigate, we provide a systematic algorithm to check if the robots will be stable along the given path while considering the maximum constraints on the tension generated or supported by the tether. The results are validated via simulation experiments.

publications.name: Logarithmic Lenses: Exploring Log RGB Data for Image Classification
publications.description: This paper discusses the limited exploration of image pre-processing in computer vision beyond standard practices like normalization and data augmentation. It suggests that the processing techniques used for human viewing may not be optimal for computer vision tasks. The study investigates the use of linear and logarithmic RGB data derived from RAW images for training deep network architectures. It finds that networks trained on logarithmic RGB data perform better on standard tests and are more robust to changes in intensity and color balance. The research also indicates that similar benefits can be achieved with standard 8-bit sRGB-JPG data by inverting the sRGB transform and applying logarithmic processing. Furthermore, the study highlights the importance of appropriate meta-parameters when training with logarithmic data. To support further research, the authors introduce a new image dataset, RAW10, specifically designed for exploring the potential of logarithmic RGB data in deep learning applications in computer vision.

publications.name: WiTHy A*: Winding-Constrained Motion Planning for Tethered Robot using Hybrid A*
publications.description: In this paper, a variant of hybrid A* is developed to find the shortest path for a curvature-constrained robot, that is tethered at its start position, such that the tether satisfies user-defined winding angle constraints. A variant of tangent graphs is used as an underlying graph for searching a path using A * in order to reduce the overall computation and define appropriate cost metrics to ensure winding angle constraints are satisfied. Conditions are provided under which the proposed algorithm is guaranteed to find a winding angle constrained path. The effectiveness and performance of the proposed algorithm are studied in simulation.
